title: Citi Experts to Gather at Latin America Financial Institutions Forum 2011
summary: Miami, Fla. – In an effort to share best practices, analyze and discuss innovation in transaction services affecting financial institutions in Latin America and provide a networking opportunity, Citi Global Transaction Services hosted the "Latin America Financial Institutions Forum" from June 8 to June 10 at the JW Marriott Marquis in Miami, Florida.
tag-1: Citi Experts to Gather at Latin America Financial Institutions Forum 2011
tag-3: Miami, Fla. – In an effort to share best practices, analyze and discuss innovation in transaction services affecting financial institutions in Latin America and provide a networking opportunity, Citi Global Transaction Services hosted the "Latin America Financial Institutions Forum" from June 8 to June 10 at the JW Marriott Marquis in Miami, Florida.
tag-4: During the event, Citi's global and regional experts discussed the latest compliance requirements that should be considered by banks across the region and the most relevant highlights of Basel III and its impact on the financial systems in Latin America.
tag-5: "As Latin America's banking industry matures, it is pivotal to create forums for discussion and analysis on the impact of landmark regulatory trends could have in Latin America," said Francisco Aristeguieta, Latin America & Mexico Region Head.
tag-6: Additional topics of discussion during this event include Asia-Latin America economic and trade relations and the assessment on the impact of North Africa and Middle East tensions on Latin America. These topics are very relevant as Chinese and other Asian companies are now playing a substantial role in cross-border trade with Latin American markets, and North Africa and the Middle East have recently undergone seismic shifts in their social, political and economic dynamics.
tag-7: "With the Latin America Financial Institutions Forum, we are hoping to share our experience and expertise and create a most-needed opportunity for discussion," said Gordon Joost, Bank Services Group Region Head for Latin America.
tag-8: This invitation-only program will be followed by a similar event directed to the different industries' most influential decision-makers from across the Latin America region. This event takes place in Miami the week of July 13.
tag-9: Global Transaction Services, a division of Citi's Institutional Clients Group, offers integrated cash management, trade, and securities and fund services to multinational corporations, financial institutions and public sector organizations around the world. With a network that spans more than 100 countries, Citigroup's Global Transaction Services supports over 65,000 clients. As of the first quarter of 2011, it held on average $355 billion in liability balances and $13 trillion in assets under custody.
tag-10: Citi Citi, the leading global financial services company, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management. Additional information may be found at www.citigroup.com.
